intro: Dianthus pulcherrimus, commonly known as the showy campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its vibrant, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and features narrow, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Dianthus pulcherrimus is also known for its historical use in herbal medicine.
